qas.question: During what war was the island used as a Royal Navy station?
What was the islands codename during World War II?
Who was the administrator during World War II for the island?

plausible_answers.text: top secret Royal Navy weather and radio station

qas.question: What were the islands used as during World War I?
What were the islands code-named during World War I?
The islands were used as a base during World War I to monitor what type of boats?
What kind of contact were Navy U-boats required to maintain?
By who was the second administrator appointed?

context: During <a0_0>World War II<a0_0/>, the islands were used as a <b3_0>top secret Royal Navy weather and radio station<b3_0/> codenamed <a1_0><b4_0>HMS Atlantic Isle<b4_0/><a1_0/>, to monitor <b5_0>Nazi U-boats<b5_0/> (which were required to maintain <b6_0>radio<b6_0/> contact) and shipping movements in the South Atlantic Ocean. The first Administrator, <a2_0>Surgeon Lieutenant Commander E.J.S. Woolley<a2_0/>, was appointed by the <b7_0>British government<b7_0/> during this time.
